wizard_welcome_reconfigure.description:
🔧 **OIG Cloud Configuration Change**

This wizard will guide you through updating your integration configuration.

**What you can change:**
• 📦 Enable/disable modules and features
• ⏱️ Adjust data update intervals
• ☀️ Change solar forecast settings
• 🔋 Adjust battery prediction parameters
• 💰 Change pricing settings
• ⚡ Adjust extended sensors

**Note:** Login credentials cannot be changed here - you must delete and re-add the integration.

Click "Submit" to continue with the setup.

wizard_boiler.title: 🔥 Boiler Configuration
wizard_boiler.description:
{step}
{progress}

📖 **What this module does:**
Intelligently plans boiler heating based on spot electricity prices. Selects the cheapest time slots for heating water before your deadline.

🔧 **What is needed:**
• 💰 Spot prices (must be enabled)
• 🌡️ Boiler temperature sensors (top and optionally bottom)
• ⚡ Heating element power

💡 **How it works:**
1. Calculates how much energy you need to heat the water
2. Finds the cheapest time slots before deadline (e.g., 20:00)
3. Creates a plan of when to turn on the boiler
4. Controls a switch for turning heating on/off

⚠️ **Note:** This module only controls WHEN to heat. Physical switching of the boiler must be handled by automation or smart switch.

data.boiler_has_alternative_heating: Does boiler have alternative heat source?
data.go_back: ⬅️ I want to go back (check + click Submit)

data_description.boiler_volume_l: Total volume of hot water tank (e.g., 120 liters)
data_description.boiler_cold_inlet_temp_c: Temperature of incoming cold water from mains (typically 10-15°C)
data_description.boiler_temp_sensor_top: Entity ID of temperature sensor at top of boiler (e.g., sensor.boiler_temperature_top)
data_description.boiler_temp_sensor_bottom: Entity ID of temperature sensor at bottom - for more accurate calculation with stratified boilers
data_description.boiler_stratification_mode: simple_avg = average temperature | two_zone = stratified model (more accurate, needs 2 sensors)
data_description.boiler_heater_power_kw_entity: Entity ID of sensor with current power (e.g., sensor.boiler_power). If you don't have one, create a helper with constant value (e.g., 2.0 for 2kW)
data_description.boiler_heater_switch_entity: Entity ID of switch for turning on main heating element (e.g., switch.boiler_heater). This will be controlled by the integration.
data_description.boiler_alt_heater_switch_entity: Entity ID of switch for alternative source (e.g., boiler, heat pump). Leave empty if you don't have one.
data_description.boiler_has_alternative_heating: Check if you have alternative heating method (boiler, HP) and want to use it when electricity is expensive
data_description.boiler_alt_cost_kwh: Cost per kWh from alternative source (e.g., 1.5 CZK/kWh for boiler). Electric heating will be used only when spot price is cheaper.
data_description.boiler_spot_price_sensor: Entity ID of spot price sensor (e.g., sensor.oig_2206237016_spot_price_current_15min)
data_description.boiler_deadline_time: Time by which you want boiler heated (format HH:MM, e.g., 20:00). Planning will always find cheapest slots BEFORE this time.
data_description.boiler_planning_horizon_hours: How far ahead to plan (typically 24-48 hours). More = better optimization but longer calculation.
data_description.boiler_plan_slot_minutes: Size of time blocks for planning (15-60 minutes). Smaller = more precise, larger = simpler. Recommended 60 minutes.
data_description.go_back: Check this box and press 'Submit' - you will go back one step

wizard_boiler.title: 🔥 Boiler Configuration
wizard_boiler.description:
{step}
{progress}

📖 **What this module does:**
Intelligently plans water heater heating based on spot electricity prices. Selects the cheapest time slots to heat water before your set deadline.

🔧 **What is needed:**
• 💰 Spot prices (must be enabled)
• 🌡️ Boiler temperature sensors (top and optionally bottom)
• ⚡ Heater power

💡 **How it works:**
1. Calculates how much energy you need to heat the water
2. Finds the cheapest time slots before deadline (e.g., 20:00)
3. Creates a plan when to turn on the boiler
4. Controls the switch for turning heating on/off

⚠️ **Note:** This module only controls WHEN to heat. Physical boiler switching must be handled via automation or smart switch.

data.boiler_has_alternative_heating: Does boiler have alternative heat source?

data_description.boiler_volume_l: Total volume of hot water tank (e.g., 120 liters)
data_description.boiler_target_temp_c: What temperature to heat water to (typically 55-65°C)
data_description.boiler_cold_inlet_temp_c: Cold water inlet temperature from mains (typically 10-15°C)
data_description.boiler_temp_sensor_top: Entity ID of temperature sensor at top of boiler (e.g., sensor.boiler_temperature_top)
data_description.boiler_temp_sensor_bottom: Entity ID of temperature sensor at bottom - for more accurate calculation in stratified boilers
data_description.boiler_stratification_mode: simple_avg = temperature average | two_zone = stratified model (more accurate, needs 2 sensors)
data_description.boiler_heater_power_kw_entity: Entity ID of sensor with current power (e.g., sensor.boiler_power). If you don't have one, create a helper with constant value (e.g., 2.0 for 2kW)
data_description.boiler_heater_switch_entity: Entity ID of switch to turn on main heating element (e.g., switch.boiler_heater). This will be controlled by the integration.
data_description.boiler_alt_heater_switch_entity: Entity ID of switch for alternative source (e.g., boiler, heat pump). Leave empty if you don't have one.
data_description.boiler_has_alternative_heating: Check if you have alternative heating method (boiler, HP) and want to use it when electricity is expensive
data_description.boiler_alt_cost_kwh: How much 1 kWh from alternative source costs (e.g., 1.5 CZK/kWh for boiler). Electric heating will be used only when spot price is cheaper.
data_description.boiler_spot_price_sensor: Entity ID of spot price sensor (e.g., sensor.oig_2206237016_spot_price_current_15min)
data_description.boiler_deadline_time: By when you want boiler heated (format HH:MM, e.g., 20:00). Planning always finds cheapest slots BEFORE this time.
data_description.boiler_planning_horizon_hours: How far ahead to plan (typically 24-48 hours). More = better optimization but longer calculation.
data_description.boiler_plan_slot_minutes: Size of time blocks for planning (15-60 minutes). Smaller = more precise, larger = simpler. Recommended 60 minutes.
